Title: Research Scientist
Description:
Job Details
Description
Responsabilities:
The candidate will carry out formulation development work on innovative dosage forms and/or platforms Solid, Oral Liquid and sterile injectable dosage forms under the supervision of a Manager.
The candidate will participate in discussions, provide scientific inputs and execute the tasks.
The candidate will coordinate with the analytical team, warehouse, tech transfer and pilot plant in carrying out his duties.

Prepare and make presentations and reports on progress of projects.
Perform literature review on published work and Patents.

Monitor short term stability of the prototype formulation.
Supervise and plan for scale-up and registration batches.

Provides inputs in the packaging selection/optimization.
Compiles product development reports based on QbD format.
Reviews Batch production records.
Writes the API requisition for development batches and registration batches.
Supports company initiatives on Lean six sigma.
Supports company initiatives on Quality by design.

Skills, knowledge and abilities:
Background knowledge and experience in pharmaceutical technology and development of innovative platform technologies and/or sterile injectable dosage forms.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Worker Type: Employee
Group: Upstream Engagement & Analytics Department
Job Post End Date: 09/14/2019
About Cenovus
We’re a Canadian integrated oil and natural gas company headquartered in Calgary. We’re committed to maximizing value by responsibly developing our assets in a safe, innovative and efficient way.
Our operations include oil sands projects in northern Alberta, which use specialized methods to drill and pump the oil to the surface, and established natural gas and oil production in Alberta and British Columbia. We also have 50 percent ownership in two U.S. refineries.
Our shares trade under the symbol CVE, and are listed on the Toronto and New York stock exchanges.
Job Description
Cenovus is looking for Data Scientist who is passionate about data with the training and curiosity to make discoveries in a world of big data. They understand and have practical applied experience in advanced mathematics and Artificial Intelligence (AI) methods. They are at ease with using big data tools on cloud enabled environments. They are capable of designing, executing and interpreting analytical experiments in a methodological way and writing software to clean and investigate large, messy data sets of numerical and textual data while integrating with external sources and APIs to discover interesting trends and insights. They are highly adept in evaluating alternate models through the application of theoretical approaches. They understand the tenants of reproducible research and tidy data.
This opportunity is an instrumental role in the conversion of Cenovus into a data-driven decision-making corporation. The Data Scientist is central in the process of mutating data into actionable insights.
Work environment:
This is a full-time employee position based in our downtown Calgary offices.
Responsibilities:
Researches and develops machine learning models for data analysis
Collaborates with Product Owners and Data Specialists to understand company needs and devise possible solutions
Keeps up-to-date with the latest technology trends so that they can be incorporated into the Cenovus Data Analytics toolbox
Understands and has practical applied experience in advanced mathematics and statistics, correlation, causation, primary component analysis and singular value decomposition
Write software to clean and investigate large, messy data sets of numerical and textual data while integrating with external sources and APIs to discover interesting trends and insights
Succinctly articulate results, insights and ideas to key decision-makers through using the data to tell a good story
Accountable to implements statistical-learning or other mathematical methodologies as needed for specific models or analysis
Facilitates joint-development efforts applied to data problems through creation of solution architectures and data products as necessary
Co-organize and facilitate training sessions to elevate the general analytics practice at Cenovus
Assist and advise citizen scientists with their own analytics projects
Qualifications:
Must be legally entitled to work in Canada
Three to 10 years of progressive experience in advanced analytics
Experience developing predictive models using machine learning or equivalent approaches in a professional setting
Experience programming with R and/or Python
Experience with AWS analytics tools
Experience using AI or ML on time series data from operations/manufacturing process controls
Notification
To be considered for a position, please click Apply and create an account or sign in to your Cenovus Careers profile.
Immediately following successful submission of your online application, you will receive an online notification confirming Cenovus's receipt of your resume.
Only those applicants who apply directly to a posted position and are selected for an interview will be contacted. We will not accept agency or third-party candidate submissions.
To follow the status of your application, log in to your Cenovus Careers profile and click on the appropriate job under ‘My Applications’.
Interested in this opportunity? Click the Apply link below.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Flashfood is looking for experienced analysts to join our Analytics team and help drive growth, understanding, and success. We are looking for candidates who have deep technical skills and are comfortable working in an evolving technology infrastructure to help us make data-informed decisions. You will be scrappy, independent, and excited about having a big impact and helping to solve hard problems.

You will partner closely with Finance, Marketing, & Product to provide visibility into our data, craft narratives, find insights, and provide recommendations. Analytics works closely with Engineering to transform data into products and insights that allow the rest of the company to make better decisions faster.

Responsibilities

Use data to inform and influence the direction of team roadmaps and inform business decisions
Work with key stakeholders to define goals and identify metrics for improving existing features and new releases
Deepen our understanding of patterns/trends in user behaviour, design experiments, and uncover new opportunities
Build dashboards and reports to drive awareness and understanding of metrics and experiment results
Work closely with Engineering to author and develop core data sets that empower operational and exploratory analyses


Requirements:

Experience doing quantitative analysis
A proven track record of using analysis to impact key business or product decisions
The ability to clearly and effectively communicate the results of complex analyses
Experience writing production dataset in SQL, OR building internal/production data tools for ETL, experimentation, or exploration in a scripting language (Python, R, etc)
A solid grasp of basic statistical applications and methods (experimentation, probabilities, regression)
Experience in software engineering, data engineering, consulting, or academic research a plus


Flashfood is a mobile platform connecting surplus food directly to its users at massive discounts to reduce food waste. Users see deals on surplus food through their phone, pay through their phone and pick it up any time same day in store. Flashfood is currently operating across Canada with Loblaw and is organizing a series of grocery partnerships in the US.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Assurance
At Assurance we are disrupting the antiquated and inefficient world of insurance and financial services. Our team of world class software engineers, data scientists, and business professionals are modernizing how people obtain and manage their financial life all through our powerful platform ecosystem. We are rapidly growing as we expand our product offerings and global footprint, and this growth continues to present new and exciting challenges as we push our industry into its future. We eliminate waste throughout the industry and calculate the complex into simple, valuable solutions to improve people's lives. We are humble, driven, and committed to improving the lives of millions.

About the Position
As we build the future of consumer insurance in a modern age, data is at the core of everything that we do. The role requires team members who are adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for optimization and can leverage appropriate models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. Our team uses a variety of data mining and analysis methods, a variety of data tools, builds and implements models, develops algorithms, and creates simulations. Team members must be very comfortable writing production-ready code to include testing and maintenance infrastructure, and able to put models and analysis into production with no support from engineering (we own our stack end to end). At Assurance, we hire experts in their field, and we give them the independence and trust to build based on their expertise.

To be successful in this role, you must possess the following:
Proficiency in either Python or R, and expertise in SQL.
Experience working with AWS or another cloud-based computing platform.
Experience and working knowledge of data infrastructure, pipelines, and advanced data manipulation.
Experience with BI tools like Tableau or Looker (preferred), or any other industry tool such Qlik, PowerBI, Spotfire, etc.
Excellent communication ability – you can explain your work in a way that anyone on the team can understand, and you can frame problems in a way that ensures the right question is being asked.
Business Acumen – you are always eager to understand how the business works, and more specifically, how your work impacts the business.
Enthusiastic yet humble – you are excited about the work you do, but you are also humble enough to embrace feedback – you don’t need to be the smartest person in the room.
The following additional experience is desired:
Experience retraining a model within a few days or update a model within one day.
Capable of performing an in-depth analysis and summarizing findings in one day.
Comfortable having conversations with our executive team and non-technical team members to distill down their needs and to deliver actionable insights.
About You
You have a proven ability to drive business results with data-based insights and are comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes. You’re capable of getting data for analysis on your own, without reliance on engineering, and you can build professional dashboards as standalone software products and tools. We’re growing at a rapid pace, so it’s important that you embrace the opportunity to blaze your own trail. You thrive in a fast-paced environment where priorities can shift rapidly as we corner opportunity. You can work independently, with little oversight or guidance.

If this sounds like a good fit for you, give us a shout, we’d love to chat!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer / Data Scientist
Description:
7Geese is growing fast and we’re seeking talented full time machine learning engineers and data scientists to help continue the performance management revolution.

Who we are
7Geese is a fun, ambitious startup helping people to grow and achieve more in their work. Our platform encourages continuous feedback, coaching, peer recognition, and OKR goal setting. Established in 2012, we are a mature product in an emerging market, with over 300 customers worldwide, served by our small (but growing!) and diverse team in Vancouver, Canada. Our office is nestled in the heart of the bustling and historic Gastown.

Why you should join us
Be heard: Our open management culture encourages you to make your voice heard and allows anyone to take charge of a project and team
Enjoy your work, enjoy your life: We offer all our employees competitive salaries, truly flexible work schedules, regular remote working, a generous flexible vacation policy, maternity / paternity leave and a comprehensive extended benefits plan.
A product to believe in: At 7Geese we use our own product on a daily basis. We use 7Geese to set team and personal goals, get feedback, and create career growth plans to maximize professional growth.
Never go hungry: Our kitchen is always stocked with snacks and drinks to keep that brain of yours fuelled and finely tuned.
Perpetual learning machine: We dedicate one week every quarter to learning new skills and technologies. We also host weekly lunch and learns. Free food and a show, what could be better?
Deploy small, deploy often: We use modern continuous integration and deployment processes, so our users benefit from your genius immediately
The Role
Research and implement new features related to data and machine learning. These might involve NLP, recommender systems, classification algorithms, or other techniques and tools
Improve and continue building out our data pipeline
Work closely with our product squads to uncover insights and data trends to inform new product development
Help our customer success team develop reports that make our customers more successful
Work with the leadership team to answer questions which allow our business to move forward
About you
You are a team player and welcome exposure to people at all levels and departments
You have a passion for technology, the desire to champion ideas and share your knowledge
You take pride in your work and have an appreciation for the user experience
You are receptive to feedback and are excited to learn and share with your awesome colleagues

2+ years of industry experience
Experience with Python and some aspect of machine learning or data analysis
Ability to learn new technologies quickly
Comfortable working independently in a small team

Experience with AWS
Do you contribute to open source projects or have a passion project? Tell us about it!
Not for you? Perhaps you know someone who would be a perfect fit? Share this with them. Thanks!

Ericsson permet aux fournisseurs de services de communication de saisir toute la valeur de la connectivité. Le portefeuille de la société touche les réseaux, les services numériques, les services gérés et les entreprises émergentes. Il permet d'aider nos clients à passer au numérique, à accroître leur efficacité, à trouver de nouvelles sources de revenus. Les investissements d’Ericsson dans l’innovation ont permis à des milliards de personnes du monde entier, de bénéficier des avantages de la téléphonie et du haut débit mobile. L'action Ericsson est cotée au Nasdaq de Stockholm et au Nasdaq de New York. www.ericsson.com

Le site d’Ericsson de Montréal compte plus de 1 200 professionnels travaillant dans notre centre de R & D et de services.

Nombreux sont les experts de classe mondiale opérant dans la création et l’installation de systèmes sans fil, évolués et de la nouvelle génération,
pour nos nombreux clients au Canada, en Amérique du Nord et dans le monde.

Il sera pratiquement impossible pour l’homme de comprendre comment exploiter et optimiser la prochaine génération de réseaux sans fil. La combinaison de réseaux sans fil 5G, de l'Edge computing réparti et de l'accès aux données en temps réel dans un environnement d’appareils portatifs, orientera les réseaux et les produits de la prochaine génération vers une évolution économique et sociale de tous les aspects de la société. Les techniques d'Intelligence Artificielle (acronyme « AI » en anglais) et de l'Apprentissage Automatique (acronyme « ML » en anglais) seront essentielles pour nous-mêmes et nos clients, si nous voulons tirer parti de ces opportunités. À cette fin, nous mettons en place un Global AI Accelerator au Canada, aux États-Unis, en Suède et en Inde, grâce à 300 experts, afin que notre stratégie soit plus rapidement exécutée. L’équipe canadienne, située à Montréal, comptera plus de 30 employés.

L'Intelligence automatisée (acronyme « MI » en anglais), la combinaison de l'apprentissage automatique (ML) et d'autres techniques liées à l'Intelligence Artificielle (AI), est ce à quoi Ericsson fait appel pour stimuler une administration réfléchie, visant à automatiser et à faire évoluer les activités ainsi que les produits et services proposés par Ericsson. La MI est également un moyen capital permettant de voir surgir de nouvelles entreprises. Notamment la création de modèles, de cadres et d'infrastructures, dans le cadre desquels nous repoussons les frontières de la technologie au fur et à mesure de notre évolution. Nous nous engageons dans des collaborations académiques et industrielles, et stimulons la numérisation d'Ericsson et l'industrie en trouvant les meilleurs solutions pour simplifier et automatiser les procédés utilisés dans nos produits et services, et créons quelle que chose de nouveau et d'utile grâce aux informations procurées par les données.

Ericsson recherche actuellement un dirigeant expérimenté pour diriger son équipe de MI à Montréal. Le poste relèvera de l'équipe Global AI Accelerator.

Récapitulatif des fonctions:
En tant que Directeur du MI à Montréal, vous devez très bien connaitre la Science des données (DS), l’apprentissage automatique et la programmation, ainsi qu’être compétent en direction afin de constituer une solide équipe locale. Vous utiliserez vos connaissances et / ou votre expérience en méthodologies de la Science des données pour diriger une équipe de professionnels, dans le but de résoudre des problèmes concrets dans le cadre d'une équipe dynamique et internationale. Vous travaillerez dans un environnement hautement collaboratif, où vous communiquerez et planifierez des tâches et les idées, dans le cadre d'initiatives très influentes dans le domaine de l’Intelligence automatisée, afin de stimuler la croissance et la rentabilité économique d'Ericsson et de ses clients, en décuplant ce que propose actuellement Ericsson. Votre contribuerez également à créer de nouveaux produits dans les domaines des réseaux 4G et 5G dirigés par MI, du cloud réparti, de l'Internet des objets et d'autres nouvelles activités.

Vos fonctions et responsabilités:
Entreprendre des analyses fonctionnelles et technologiques au sein d'une entreprise d'Ericsson et de certains clients clés, afin de découvrir les besoins et les opportunités professionnelles liés à la MI.

Diriger une équipe pour créer rapidement et répétitivement un système viable et sûr répondant à ces besoins. Notamment travailler avec des pétaoctets de réseaux 4G/5G, IoT et données exogènes, proposer / sélectionner / tester des modèles prédictifs, moteurs de recommandation, systèmes de détection d'anomalies, modèle statistique, apprentissage approfondi, apprentissage par renforcement et autres systèmes d'apprentissage automatique.

Participer à des études et trouver une utilisation créative de nouvelles et existantes sources de données. Travailler en utilisant des données.

Travailler auprès de scientifiques et d'architectes de données pour tirer parti des modèles de données existants, et en créer de nouveaux en fonction des besoins.

Établir une équipe MI à Montréal et diriger son travail afin qu'il corresponde aux objectifs, plans et tâches de l'équipe Global AI Accelerator.

Collaborer avec les équipes de création de produits et les partenaires des entreprises d'Ericsson, à industrialiser des modèles et des produits d'apprentissage automatique dans ce que propose Ericsson, notamment en fournissant des codes sources, des documents et en établissant le déroulement des travaux.

Travailler avec de nouvelles technologies et les appuyer au sein des communautés MI d'Ericsson.

Aider les entreprises et les services à la clientèle d’Ericsson, à accumuler des compétences en MI.

Aider à créer de nouveaux concepts, de nouvelles méthodes et techniques consacrés aux initiatives plurifonctionnelles, tout en les appliquant et en améliorant ceux existants.

Établir des relations avec les communautés externe (universités, leaders technologiques, logiciels publics - open source -, etc.) afin de faire évoluer le portefeuille de compétences et de technologies contribuant aux besoins de la MI.

Pour être le candidat idéal, vous devez détenir :
Master ou doctorat en génie électrique, informatique, intelligence artificielle, apprentissage automatique, physique ou dans un domaine apparenté.

Expérience : Plus de 2 années d'expérience en apprentissage automatique en Science des données.

Expérience confirmée dans la direction et la constitution d'équipes hautement motivées et axées sur les résultats.

Capacité de travailler de façon autonome avec beaucoup d'énergie, d'enthousiasme et de persévérance.

Expérience en création de modèles et en gestion du cycle de vie dans un ou plusieurs domaines de l'industrie / d'application.

Compétences en programmation en différents langages (C++, Scala, Java, R) et compétences en Python et / ou en C++.

Compétences en apprentissage automatique, par exemple : analyse discriminante par régression linéaire / logistique, bagging, forêts aléatoires, réseau bayésien, SVM, réseaux de neurones artificiels, etc.

Solides compétences en utilisation de cadres d'apprentissage automatique à la fine pointe de la technologie, notamment Scikit-Learn, H2O, Keras, TensorFlow et Spark, etc.

Aptitude avérée à utiliser de nouveaux algorithmes et méthodologies à partir d'initiatives publiques de premier plan, et d'articles de recherche abordant leurs fonctionnalités, leur faculté d'évoluer et leur viabilité générale en matière d'industrialisation.

Expérience en technologies Big Data notamment Hadoop, Cassandra, etc.

Grandes connaissances des statistiques, par exemple : analyse descriptive et analyse supervisée et non supervisée.

Capable de travailler au sein d'un environnement en collaboration, à savoir, capable de travailler avec plusieurs services commerciaux complexes de parties prenantes, des clients dans le monde, des partenaires technologiques et autres au sein d'une organisation mondiale et pluriculturelle, le tout avec délicatesse et persistance.

Bon anglais et français, tant à l'écrit qu'à l'oral

Sont un « plus » :
Certifier MI MOOCS.

Connaissances en applications / domaines des réseaux de télécommunication et / ou IoT.

Capacité d'établir et d'encadrer des communautés internes et externes.

Expérience en visualisation des données et en création de tableaux de bord.

Expérience en rédaction et en présentation de livres blancs, articles de revues et blogs techniques portant sur les résultats.
ENGLISH VERSION:

Ericsson enables communications service providers to capture the full value of connectivity. The company’s portfolio spans Networks, Digital Services, Managed Services, and Emerging Business and is designed to help our customers go digital, increase efficiency and find new revenue streams. Ericsson’s investments in innovation have delivered the benefits of telephony and mobile broadband to billions of people around the world. The Ericsson stock is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm and on Nasdaq New York. www.ericsson.com

Ericsson’s Montreal site has more than 1,200 professionals working in our R&D and Services Centre. Many are world-class experts developing and implementing advanced and next generation wireless systems for our many customers in Canada, North America and across the world.

It will be practically impossible for human brains to understand how to run and optimize next generation of wireless networks. The combination of 5G wireless networks with distributed edge compute and access to real-time data in a mobile environment, will drive next-generation networks and solutions towards economic and social transformation for all aspects of society. Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) technologies will be vital for us and our customers to take advantage of these opportunities. To that end, we are setting up a Global AI Accelerator in Canada, the US, Sweden and India, with 300 experts, to fast-track our strategy execution. The Canadian team, based in Montreal, will be >30 employees.

Machine Intelligence (MI), the combination of Machine Learning (ML) and other Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies is what Ericsson uses to drive thought leadership to automate and transform Ericsson offerings and operations. MI is also a key competence for to enable new and emerging business. This includes development of models, frameworks and infrastructure where we in our advancements push the technology frontiers. We engage in both academic and industry collaborations and drive the digitalization of Ericsson and the Industry by developing state of the art solutions that simplify and automate processes in our products and services and build new value through data insights.

Ericsson is now looking for a senior and experienced leader to head-up its Montreal-based MI team. The position will report into the Global AI Accelerator team.

Role Summary:
As the Montreal MI team head, you will need to have an advanced understanding of Data Science (DS), Machine Learning and programming, as well as, managerial skills to build a strong local team. You will use your knowledge and/or experience in Data Science methodologies to lead a team of professionals in solving challenging real-world problems as part of a highly dynamic and global team. Working in a highly collaborative environment, where you communicate and plan tasks and ideas, on high impact initiatives in Machine Intelligence to drive growth and economic profitability for Ericsson and its customers by accelerating current Ericsson offerings. Your contribution will also help to create new offerings in the areas of MI driven 4G and 5G network, distributed cloud, IoT and other emerging businesses.

Your Roles and Responsibilities:
Conduct functional and technical analysis within Ericsson organization and strategic customers to understand MI-driven business needs and opportunities.

Lead a team for rapid and iterative development of validated minimum viable solution addressing these needs. This includes working with petabytes of 4G/5G-networks, IoT and exogenous data, and proposing/selecting/testing predictive models, recommendation engines, anomaly detection systems, statistical model, deep learning, reinforcement learning and other machine learning systems.

Participate in studies and find creative usage of new and/or existing data sources. Work with Data Scientists and Architects to leverage existing data models and build new ones, as needed.

Build the Montreal-based MI team and manage their work to be in-line with the Global AI Accelerator team’s objectives, plans and assignments.

Collaborate with product development teams and partners in Ericsson Businesses to industrialize machine learning models and solutions as part of Ericsson offerings including providing source code, workflows and documents.

Work with new technologies and champion them in MI Communities within Ericsson.

Assist MI Competence build-up in Ericsson businesses and Customer serving units.

Help to develop new and apply/extend existing, concepts, methodologies, techniques for cross functional initiatives.

Engage with external ecosystem (academia, technology leaders, open source etc.) to develop the skills and technology portfolio for MI’s needs.

To be successful; one should have:
MS, or PhD in Electrical Engineer, Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Physics, or related field.

Applied experience: 2+ years of Machine Learning experience in data science.

Proven track-record in management and building highly motivated and results-oriented teams.

Ability to work independently with high energy, enthusiasm and persistence.

Extensive experience in model development and life-cycle-management in one or more industry/application domain.

Programming skills in various languages (C++, Scala, Java, R) with proficiency in Python and/or C++

Skills in Machine Learning, e.g., linear/logistics regression discriminant analysis, bagging, random forest, Bayesian model, SVM, neural networks, etc.

Strong skills in the use of current state of the art machine learning frameworks such as Scikit-Learn, H2O, Keras, TensorFlow and Spark, etc.

Demonstrated ability to implement new algorithms and methodologies from leading open source initiatives and research papers addressing their functionalities, scalability and overall industrialization viability.

Experience with Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, Cassandra etc.

Strong knowledge in Statistics, e.g., descriptive analysis and supervised and unsupervised analysis.

Ability to work in a collaborative environment, i.e., working with complex multiple stakeholder business units, global customers, technology and other ecosystem partners in a multi-culture, global matrix organization with sensitivity and persistence.

Good communication skills in written and spoken English and French.

You may have:
Certifying MI MOOCS.

Applications/Domain-knowledge in Telecommunication networks and/or IoT.

Ability to build and nurture internal and external communities.

Experience with data visualization and dashboard creation.

Experience in writing and presenting white papers, journal articles and technical blogs on the results.

DISCLAIMER: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of employees assigned to this position. Therefore employees assigned may be required to perform additional job tasks required by the manager.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer / Data Scientist
Description:
The Opportunity
Do you enjoy solving complex problems? Are you a systems thinker who’d rather debate the concept than argue the example? Do you prize logic, feel accountable and hold others to a high standard?
If your answer to these questions is “yes”, then we want to hear from you! Every day, SkyHive's startup environment will present new challenges, opportunities to grow, and a place to build something truly unique.
We are looking for a talented machine learning / data scientist who can dive into high volumes of quantitative data, raw telemetry, and survey data. The ideal candidate will have a strong foundation in data science and will be willing to take initiative in pioneering new methods of modeling and analytics.
The Role
- Perform research in NLP/Deep Learning and build machine learning models to improve content understanding, content ranking & recommendations.
- Prototype machine learning algorithms and assess how to apply them to solve business problems.
- Analyze data sources and perform data collection/annotation.
- Maintain and improve the performance and effectiveness of existing Natural Language Processing (NLP) algorithms.
- Work with the team to build data pipeline/infrastructure to deliver machine learning algorithms into production
Who are you?
Qualifications (Must haves)
- Minimum 2 years of Python experience
- Knowledge of and experience working with machine learning tools such as Tensorflow, PyTorch, Keras, spacy…
- Minimum 2 years of Natural Language Processing experience
- Familiar with Deep Learning concepts and how to do NLP using Deep Learning
- Have good developer skills supported by real-life experience
- Self-starter instincts
Nice-to-haves
- Be a Kaggler
- Have open source projects
- Know who Dirichlet, Markov, Spearman and LeCun are
- Familiarity with recent development in the field of Deep Learning/NLP
Who are we?
Recognized as a top startup by Forbes, Startup Grind, and C100, SkyHive is an award-winning AI technology that deepens our understanding of labour markets, workforces and individuals, enabling new ways of acquiring, developing and engaging talent.
Established in 2017 with the mission of tackling global poverty and social inequality, SkyHive aims to utilize its exponential technology to stimulate economic empowerment and lifelong learning; ultimately fostering a stronger, more prepared, and more confident workforce to welcome a brighter tomorrow.
What do we offer?
- Opportunity to get your foot in the door of a fast-growing tech company
- Collaborative team environment and culture with a flat organizational design
- Comprehensive health benefits package & MSP coverage
- Three weeks’ paid vacation to start, paid holidays and birthday leave!
- Stock options & gainsharing plan
- Certified B-Corp
- Paid & unpaid volunteer time off
- Charitable donation matching program to support your favorite charity.
- Opportunity to explore other departments as training and career continues.
- Professional development assistance program that covers professional continuing education
- Beautiful pet friendly office in A1 location with stunning views, beer and cider on tap and an in-house gym
- Numerous employee appreciation events throughout the year

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Who You Are

The ideal candidate excels in a vibrant environment that demands a flexible and fast-paced approach. You should be eager to learn new technical techniques as well as new scientific concepts as needed. You are passionate about data science, from cleaning, manipulating, and processing raw text data, to digging in to surface the strongest insights from a dataset, to distilling and polishing those insights to appeal to an outside audience. You're dedicated to the pursuit of insights that are well-validated, reliable, and user-friendly. Finally, you have a keen interest for understanding human behaviour, and the technical aptitude to support your passion.

What You’ll Be Doing


Taking responsibility for customer engagements from start to finish. This means project planning, reading up on related work, using our existing code-base (and writing new code) to get the most from the data, to documenting and showcasing your findings.
Drawing on your background and your teammates’ backgrounds to solve new problems as they arise and deliver insights to customers.
Translating complex technical insights into simple insights that people can use.
Contributing new and innovative ideas to make our client deliverables and product offerings the highest quality possible.
Relying on the scientific standards and principles established within the fields of Psychology and Linguistics to inform the insights that you draw from data.
Using a range of tools and languages to work with data, including Tableau, R, Python, and JavaScript.
Playing a valuable role in cross-functional team discussions and contributing to the quality of all the work we do.
Responding to input from peers and managers on all of your work. Our best work is created collaboratively, and incorporating a range of good ideas and opinions into your work is critical to success.
Required skills:


Strong experience in data science
A strong background in math and statistics, especially in applying statistical analysis and modelling in social science contexts
A keen interest in understanding human behaviour with an understanding of concepts from Psychology, Economics, Philosophy, Sociology, and related fields
Programming and computer science; you’ll be required to write your own code
Strong communication and teamwork skills
Ideal candidates will have:


Experience or education in Psychology
Experience in natural language processing and/or computational linguistics
Experience with statistical modelling
Familiarity with standard AI modelling techniques and tools
Not quite the right fit?

If this role doesn’t quite line up with your experience or objectives, but you would love to be part of this growing team, please consider sharing your resume with us regardless! Above all else, Receptiviti is a culture of learning- a blend of unique strengths and aptitudes go a long way, and you may have something we’re missing from this description.

About Receptiviti

Committed to making diversity and inclusivity part of our culture, Receptiviti is an equal opportunity employer. We are passionate about providing a safe workplace where everyone is accepted and has the opportunity to grow with us.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist

StackPros Inc. is seeking a full-time candidate to join our Data Systems Team in Toronto.

The Data Scientist will play a key role at StackPros, required to help create and maintain industry-leading quality and efficiency of service and software delivery.

StackPros will rely on the Data Scientist to support the Data Systems team across many types of projects. The Data Scientist will be expected to meet and exceed StackPros’ quality standards, while helping the organization rapidly expand complex Machine Learning, Deep Learning, AI and related applications.


Key Responsibilities:

Apply automated techniques to gather data from disparate databases; clean the data and load the transformed data into a structure suited to the client problem and analytics approach
Perform exploratory data analysis to identify patterns from historical data, generate and test hypotheses, and provide product owners with actionable insights
Design experiments for product initiatives and perform statistical analysis of the results with recommendations for next steps and future experiments
Building machine learning models (Linear and Logistic regression, Gradient Boosting, Random Forest, etc.) from development, validation, through to deployment in production
Help validate, maintain, optimize, and troubleshoot the performance of machine learning models being used in development and production applications
Create and design dashboards by using different data visualization tools to present reports and insights, and support business decision making
Prepare technical specifications and documentation for projects
Apply automated techniques to gather data from disparate databases; clean the data and load the transformed data into a structure suited to the client problem and analytics approach


Related/Complimentary Data Engineer Workflows:

Apply automated techniques to gather data from disparate databases; clean the data and load the transformed data into a structure suited to the client problem and analytics approach


Qualifications:

Extensive experience using Python (Pandas, Numpy, Matplotlib, Searborn) to analyze large dataset.
Extensive experience using SQL Queries to extract data from relational database
Experience working with AWS cloud or Google Cloud Platform
Experience using Spark
Experience using Scikit-Learn, Tensorflow, H2O etc.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
OpenText est une entreprise d’information, et notre mission est de créer des solutions logicielles et d’offrir des services qui redéfinissent l’avenir du numérique. Faites partie d’une équipe gagnante qui ouvre la voie en matière de gestion de l’information d’entreprise.
The opportunity:
Le scientifique de données est un membre indispensable de l’équipe OpenText Magellan, dont tous les membres travaillent de concert à développer des possibilités de revenu au sein de la clientèle et des clients éventuels d’OpenText. Le titulaire du poste devra analyser les exigences complexes des clients afin de leur présenter une proposition de valeur attirante et unique, qui tire profit d’une ou de plusieurs des solutions de la suite de gestion de l’information d’entreprise d’OpenText.

Le scientifique de données sera principalement responsable de bâtir des modèles d’apprentissage machine à l’aide de Jupyter Notebook, dans Python et R. Le scientifique de données travaillera avec l’équipe Magellan pour aider le client à visualiser la proposition de valeur en créant des démonstrations personnalisées des solutions OpenText Magellan ainsi qu’en faisant des présentations portant sur la technologie et l’entreprise devant des auditoires techniques, d’affaires et de direction.
You are great at:
Aptitudes requises :
Comprendre les concepts et les recommandations de modélisation statistique et prédictive, de même que les algorithmes d’optimisation.Travailler sur des problèmes complexes qui peuvent exiger de la recherche et une connaissance approfondie de la solution; et régler d’importants problèmes de conception en lien avec les projets futurs.Assurer un leadership technique afin de présenter des solutions gagnantes à de grandes entreprises et à des organismes gouvernementaux.Mettre en application ses compétences techniques et d’affaires pour créer et bâtir des solutions qui répondent aux besoins opérationnels du client.Élaborer les meilleures pratiques en lien avec les projets de mise en œuvre.
What it takes:
Exigences du poste :

Title: Associate Data Scientist
Description:
About Blackhawk Network:
At Achievers, our software delivers a powerful new way for companies to engage, align, and recognize employees enabling remarkable business success. Every day.

We hire ambitious professionals who thrive on their entrepreneurial spirit and want to Change the Way the World Works. As Achievers employees, we are passionate about disruptive technology, welcome constant change, and understand the value of employee success in the workplace. We enjoy coming to work every day because we believe in our product and L.O.V.E. our culture. Achievers is more than just a software company; we are industry leaders in the HR space.
Overview:
We are looking for a highly motivated, aspiring Associate Data Scientist with excellent analytical skills to join our team. You aim to please and stop at nothing to deliver for your clients, both internal and external. You have a preference for an aggressive, entrepreneurial company where change happens on a daily basis. You want to be challenged in your work and be recognized and rewarded when you go above and beyond (which is often!). Most importantly, you want to be in a place that’s full of people like you - A players who are fiercely intelligent, share a passion for their work, and know how to have fun!
Responsibilities:
We might be a good match if...

You believe data is most useful when it tells a story.
 You stay rooted with integrity for science but are not just about the numbers. You understand that for data to have true impact, it must answer a business question or address a business problem. You're excited to bridge the gap between data and business and have experience presenting your results in a clear and concise manner.
You have a curiosity for patterns and problem solving.
You get excited when given a large data set like it's a present waiting to be unwrapped and are eager to dive right in. Your mind is full of past memories where you've used data models to discover new trends and correlations.
You're a self-starter.
You’re excited to dive right in and get your hands dirty in the data. You’re not afraid to revise and retarget with feedback; you know progress often means iteration, and iteration can’t happen until you get started.
You love to think outside the box.
You're not afraid to experiment and test out new theories or models, even if they fail. You've always got an eye out for new data tools and concepts that keeps you learning. Your creative mind allows you to break away from the status quo.
You take great pride in the quality of your work.
You understand the importance of accurate data reporting and you'll double and triple check key metrics before presenting your findings.
Work with the Product team to measure feature usage and adoption, and uncover insights to guide future product investments.Work with the Client Success team to explore how recognition data relates to customer data and business metrics.Develop data models and algorithms to discover patterns and trends.Use a wide range of tools for your data mining and analysis needs.Test, validate, and refine your hypotheses with customer data.Prepare and present your findings to stakeholders, such as through white papers, infographics, presentations, or workshops.Explore and research new data tools and concepts.Support the vision of making Achievers and our customers smarter with data, through enabling data-driven decision-making and smarter actions in a variety of ways.
Qualifications:
H.BSc or M.S. degree preferred, with concentration in Statistics, Economics, Behavioural Sciences, applied sciences of any kind, or another quantitative field.Have 1-3 years experience analyzing product and/or SaaS client data.Have excellent knowledge of SQL/BI tools such as MicroStrategy or Tableau.Knowledge of machine learning methodologies/statistical modeling (regression, classification and unsupervised approaches)Strong programming skills, with a preference for Python.Data presentation and visualization skills.Have a strong background in quantitative thinking, experimental design, data analysis, statistical analysis (regression, factor analysis, etc.).Are fluent in desktop applications (Excel, Office 365).Have a deep appreciation for scientific and data integrity, attention to detail, and a client/end-user focus.Are a self-starter with a sense of urgency, solution-orientation, and ability to pivot to address feedback and changing priorities.

Excited yet? Here’s more about us …
Achievers is passionate about Employee Success™. Our Software and Services™ help companies inspire employees globally and drive business success. Our software delivers the tools your employees need to perform and stay engaged, and our services provide you with one point-of-contact to help your employees sustain results that matter. Named one of the “Best Places to Work” in the Bay Area and Canada, a “Next Generation Employer of Choice”, one of the “Top 10 Places Where Employees Thrive”, and one of Deloitte and PROFIT’s “Fastest Growing Companies”, Achievers offers an outstanding compensation plan, competitive benefits program, generous vacation policy, limitless opportunities for personal and professional growth, and a corporate culture like no other.
This is your chance to be part of an exceptional team of people and contribute to an environment where innovation and initiative are encouraged and rewarded. If you love a challenge, share our “work hard/play hard” mentality, are passionate about the impact you make on a business, thrive on change, and continuously strive for excellence in all that you do, apply for a position with us today! For more information visit http://www.achievers.com/careers
Only qualified candidates will be contacted directly.

Achievers is an equal opportunity employer and as such does not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, religion, sex, national origins, age, sexual orientation, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. Selection decisions are solely based on job-related factors.
Achievers is committed to meeting the needs of people with disabilities in a timely manner, and will do so by preventing and removing barriers to accessibility and meeting accessibility requirements under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
OpenText est une entreprise d’information, et notre mission est de créer des solutions logicielles et d’offrir des services qui redéfinissent l’avenir du numérique. Faites partie d’une équipe gagnante qui ouvre la voie en matière de gestion de l’information d’entreprise.
The opportunity:
Le scientifique de données est un membre indispensable de l’équipe OpenText Magellan, dont tous les membres travaillent de concert à développer des possibilités de revenu au sein de la clientèle et des clients éventuels d’OpenText. Le titulaire du poste devra analyser les exigences complexes des clients afin de leur présenter une proposition de valeur attirante et unique, qui tire profit d’une ou de plusieurs des solutions de la suite de gestion de l’information d’entreprise d’OpenText.

Le scientifique de données sera principalement responsable de bâtir des modèles d’apprentissage machine à l’aide de Jupyter Notebook, dans Python et R. Le scientifique de données travaillera avec l’équipe Magellan pour aider le client à visualiser la proposition de valeur en créant des démonstrations personnalisées des solutions OpenText Magellan ainsi qu’en faisant des présentations portant sur la technologie et l’entreprise devant des auditoires techniques, d’affaires et de direction.
You are great at:
Aptitudes requises :
Comprendre les concepts et les recommandations de modélisation statistique et prédictive, de même que les algorithmes d’optimisation.Travailler sur des problèmes complexes qui peuvent exiger de la recherche et une connaissance approfondie de la solution; et régler d’importants problèmes de conception en lien avec les projets futurs.Assurer un leadership technique afin de présenter des solutions gagnantes à de grandes entreprises et à des organismes gouvernementaux.Mettre en application ses compétences techniques et d’affaires pour créer et bâtir des solutions qui répondent aux besoins opérationnels du client.Élaborer les meilleures pratiques en lien avec les projets de mise en œuvre.
What it takes:
Exigences du poste :
Baccalauréat en informatique, en science de l’information, en génie, en statistiques, en mathématiques ou dans un domaine connexe.Au moins deux ans d’expérience professionnelle en analytique ou en sciences des données.Compétences en programmation et connaissance approfondie de Python, de Scala et de R.Expérience avec Jupyter Notebook.Expertise sur Spark en général et plus particulièrement sur MLlib (PySpark, Scala, SparkR).Expérience de travail avec les outils et les trousses d’analyse tels que Pandas, SciPy et Scikit-learn.Expérience avec les grands ensembles de données et l’informatique répartie (Hive/Hadoop).Expérience avec SQL, ETLs et les structures des données.Capacité de travailler dans un environnement d’équipe.Volonté de se déplacer. Dans certains cas, les déplacements peuvent être à l’international.Expérience avec Java, un atout.Connaissance de l’apprentissage profond et des réseaux neuronaux, un atout.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Dialogue is the leading Canadian telemedicine platform, delivering excellent care remotely, and allowing patients to access a full team of physicians, nurses, and other medical specialists. Our mission is to make Canadians happier, healthier, and performing at their best by helping them access health and wellness resources wherever they are, whenever they need it. Dialogue is serving a multitude of innovative and marquee employers across Canada and growing rapidly.

Our team is composed of entrepreneurs, developers, sales and customer success experts, designers, data masterminds and product, marketing and operations people who all work closely with our healthcare specialists. We’re very collaborative and fortunate to have this unique multidisciplinary team that brings a variety of perspectives to the table.

What’s data at Dialogue?
At Dialogue, we have different stakeholders engage in the data lifecycle: from generating new data to requesting integrations with a third party, analyzing, visualizing and consuming data. We are currently looking for a data scientist to help us facilitate these processes for our go-to-market teams (sales, marketing, partnerships and customer success).

Our data team handles the entire pipeline from event capture and data extraction, loading and transforming, to visualizing and consuming. We use Segment, Singer Taps, and Kinesis Firehose to get our data into the warehouse; DBT to transform data once it’s there; and Metabase and Tableau to visualize it. We work directly with stakeholders to define projects and organize them within our two week sprints. We set quarterly objectives and key results to align our function with the rest of the organization. We test our pipeline throughout and are always looking to improve the reliability of our stack and the velocity of our team. We listen closely to our stakeholders, anticipate their needs and iterate on their dashboards and data products. We believe in giving ownership to stakeholders and empowering them to dig into the data and run their own analysis.

In this role, you can expect to:

Work closely with the go-to-market teams to model and analyze sales, marketing and client data
Develop and monitor sales forecast models
Develop and improve our lead attribution model
Build client facing dashboards to demonstrate the impact of Dialogue for our clients
Work with the team to continuously improve our data pipeline
Automate testing of our data models
Who we are looking for:

3 years of experience as a data scientist or data analyst
Proficient in SQL, Python and/or R
Have experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Metabase, Looker, …)
You are a good communicator. You can take complex information and distill and synthesize it.
A plus: experience with AWS, DBT, Singer taps, Airflow, Hubspot, Salesforce
What we can offer you:

The opportunity to take an impactful position in a well-funded company growing quickly.
Being part of a team of hard-working, ambitious and caring individuals who will help you learn and grow professionally;
A competitive salary, stock options and a generous time off policy;
Top tier benefits plan including unlimited access to Dialogue for you and your family, a comprehensive parental leave program, wellness membership reimbursement and much more!;
Flexible work hours and possibility to telecommute;
A positive workplace setting and culture in a beautiful sunny Old Montreal office with steps-away subway and bikeshare access -or- an equally conveniently located Toronto office in a startup coworking space with coffee, tea, beer tap, and more.
Dialogue -

Category: Research
Positions Available: 1
Years Experience Required: 1

Posted Date: Aug 28, 2019
EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY
Research Assistant 1
Complex Care and Recovery Program
Position Description
The Complex Care and Recovery Program is seeking a part-time, contract (6 months) Research Assistant 1 to assist with ongoing research protocols. Reporting to the Medical Head, Ambulatory Services, Complex Care and Recovery Program your duties will include administrative activities, assistance with coordination, and data collection. As part of a research team, these activities may include liaising with clinical and research staff, data entry, recruiting participants, assisting with questionnaires, audit clinical record forms, work with databases and regulatory documents ensuring that accuracy and data quality is maintained and securely stored. You will support a healthy workplace that embraces diversity, encourages teamwork and complies with all applicable and regulatory requirements. This position is located at 1001 Queen Street West but some travel to other community clinics and sites will be required.
Qualifications
The successful candidate must possess a secondary school education and/or special courses. Knowledge and proficiency in internet search engines, PC software skills, including Microsoft Office are required. Previous experience with working in a hospital research setting, interacting with scientists and research participants with a diagnosis of schizophrenia is an asset. Previous experience with data collection, data checking and data entry, assistance with organizing and maintaining research files, and experience with administering research questionnaires is an asset. You will have excellent interpersonal and verbal communication skills; and function well within a cooperative, collaborative working environment. You have the ability for self-directed learning/working; while assisting concurrently on several projects. Candidates are expected to be detail oriented, well-organized, and possess a technical aptitude. You will provide candidates must be able to work effectively with individuals from diverse backgrounds. Bilingualism (English/French) and/or proficiency in another language is considered an asset.
Please Note: This part-time, contract (6 months) position is part of the OPSEU Bargaining Unit
Salary Range: $20.45 - $25.21 per hour
CAMH is a Tobacco-Free Organization.


CAMH is fully affiliated with the University of Toronto and is a teaching hospital and research institute. As a CAMH employee you will be expected to actively support CAMH’s teaching and research activities, in addition to supporting the clinical work of the hospital.
As an employment equity employer CAMH actively seeks Aboriginal peoples, visible minorities, women, people with disabilities, (including people with who have experienced mental health and substance use challenges), and additional diverse identities for our workforce.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
IN A DAY IN THE LIFE OF THE DATA SCIENTIST YOU’LL:
Have a Passion for Continuous Improvement

Understand the decision-making process, workflows, and business and information needs of business unit heads and service manager/owners
Proactively mine data warehouses to identify trends and patterns and generates insights for business units and senior leadership
Research and implement cutting-edge techniques and tools in machine learning/deep learning/artificial intelligence to make data analysis more efficient
Determine requirements that will be used to train and evolve deep learning models and algorithms

See the Big Picture

Translate business needs into analytics/reporting requirements to support executive decisions and workflows with required information
Perform large-scale experimentation to identify hidden relationships between variables in large datasets
Develop frameworks and processes to analyze unstructured information collected through social media platforms i.e., wikis, blogs, instant messaging, etc. and traditional sources such as e-mail and SharePoint.


Be a Strong Communicator

Visualize information and develops engaging reports on the results of data analysis using data visualization tools
Advise product teams on new products, features or updates through data-based recommendations
Support user experience specialists and information architects to enhance information visualization through development of dashboards and user interfaces
Distribute best practices to analytics and product teams and provides consultations for their data-based experimentations


WHAT KIND OF SKILLS SHOULD YOU HAVE?
The obvious qualities: Dedicated, Imaginative, Professional and…

Up-to-date knowledge of machine learning and data analytics tools and techniques
Strong knowledge in predictive modeling methodology
Experienced at leveraging both structured and unstructured data sources
Willingness and ability to learn new technologies on the job
Demonstrated ability to communicate complex results to technical and non-technical audiences
Demonstrated ability to work with minimal supervision


You’ll have experience with the following:
Experience using statistics and machine learning to solve complex business problems
Experience conducting statistical analysis with advanced statistical software, scripting languages, and packages
Experience with big data analysis tools and techniques
Experience building and deploying predictive models, web scrapping, and scalable data pipelines
Experience with Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services is desirable


YOU HAVE DEGREES, CREDENTIALS OR CERTIFICATIONS IN:
Master’s degree or PhD in computer science, statistics, economics, or related fields


DO YOU LIKE PERKS? SO DO WE!


In addition to a competitive salary, we offer an RRSP with company match, gym membership and several health and welfare plans including company paid Short-Term Disability and Basic Life.
Casual dress (prepare your jeans game, because that’s what we wear on most days).
Creative work environment. We always welcome innovative ideas to make our process better.

Company: Ministry of Community Safety and Correctional Services -
Title: TALENT POOL - FORENSIC SCIENTIST (FIREARMS & TOOLMARKS)
Description:
The Centre of Forensic Sciences is seeking your expertise for the role of Forensic Scientist. This is an exciting opportunity to become a part of the Ontario justice system by providing expertise and conducting forensic testing of all types of firearms, ammunition, tools and their markings seized during criminal and other investigations.

What can I expect to do in this role?
In this role you will:
Examine evidence including firearms, ammunition, propellants and clothing submitted during the course of criminal investigationsTest fire firearms in order to obtain comparison materialProvide project management and group leadership in assigned cases by acting as a scientific resource to othersProvide objective, independent scientific expertise during police and other official investigationsEducate clients on proper evidence collection and preservation, and on the applicability and limitations of scientific test resultsProvide testimony as an expert witness in all levels of courtParticipate in the laboratory accreditation processConducting, planning and coordinating research

How do I qualify?
Mandatory
An honours BSc. degree or its equivalent in one of the physical, life or forensic sciences.

Scientific Research and Applications Skills
You have:
Demonstrated experience in conducting, planning and coordinating research, including using statistics to evaluate scientific data.Demonstrated experience in a laboratory using scientific instruments to conduct examinations.Demonstrated experience is using technical standard operating procedures to conduct examinations.Demonstrated knowledge of software applications in order to evaluate data, to interpret results and to prepare reports.

Oral and Written Communication and Interpersonal Skills
You have:
Proven ability to effectively communicate complex technical informationAbility to provide clear instructions to a diverse group of peers, scientific and technical staff and provide expert testimony in court.Demonstrated experience in preparing reports for publication and/or reviewing scientific research.Experience in presenting research to an audience or providing lectures discussing scientific principles or findings.Demonstrated ability to collaborate with colleagues in a professional setting.

Technical Knowledge
You have:
Knowledge of the theories, principles and practices of Firearms & Toolmarks and ability to provide expertise and lead forensic programs.Knowledge of manufacturing methods such as techniques used to produce firearms, ammunition and tools.Knowledge and experience in the comparative sciences including, but not limited to forensic science disciplines such as firearms & toolmarks comparison, physical match, document examination, or forensic microscopy.

Other General knowledge:
You have an ability to acquire and apply knowledge of the following:
Relevant forensic sciences including scientific limitations, scene of crime and autopsy protocols. Critical review of the scientific literatureThe Canadian court system including the rules of evidence in order to fulfill the requirements. (may be acquired through attending university class, work experience, testifying in court).Relevant legislation, case law or technical standards to specific case scenarios.Quality assurance principles and practices (International Organization for Standardization) 17025 and the Occupational Health and Safety Act to ensure compliance and maintain accreditations requirements.
Additional Information:
Address:
Permanent, 25 Morton Shulman Ave, Toronto, Toronto Region, Criminal Record and Judicial Matters Check
Temporary, duration up to 12 months, 25 Morton Shulman Ave, Toronto, Toronto Region, Criminal Record and Judicial Matters Check

Compensation Group: Ontario Public Service Employees Union

We currently have an upcoming need to fill one permanent position. This competition will be used to create an eligibility list of qualified candidates to fill upcoming opportunities within the next eighteen months following the closing date of the job ad posting.
In accordance with the Ontario Public Service (OPS), Employment Screening Checks Policy (ESCP), the top candidate(s) may be required to undergo a security screening check. Refer to the above to determine the screening checks that are required for this position.

If applicable, the TSO, with your written consent, will request and obtain any additional employment screening checks that were not obtained directly by you. (Note: If a Vulnerable Sector Screening Check is required, it must also be obtained in person at your local police service).

A record under the Criminal Code and/or other federal offence record(s) does not automatically mean you will be ineligible for the position. Title: Validation Scientist II
Description:
Job Description
How will you make an impact?

With 70000 extraordinary minds on our global team, each one of us at Thermo Fisher has an important story to tell. Whether we’re helping customers to fight disease, making sure our air is clean, or solving cold cases, our stories involve thousands of important projects that improve millions of lives. Our dedicated sales professionals are laser focused on delivering our customer value proposition—accelerating innovation and enhancing productivity. With talented managers and inspiring coworkers to support you, you’ll find the resources and opportunities to make significant contributions to the world.

What you will do?

You will complete protocols and reports related to the validation of manufacturing processes, packaging processes (including serialization), equipment qualification and cleaning. You will ensure that documents conform to all Thermo Fisher Scientific Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), client requirements and Good Manufacturing Practices.
Essential Functions:
Provides technical expertise and support to Operations/Quality/Business or Project Management.
Prepares and executes validation protocols (existing and new clients) and writes reports.
Monitors production scheduling and coordinates validation activities as required.
Prepares Installation Qualification (IQ), Operational Qualification (OQ), Performance Qualification (PQ) for more complex equipment, facilities and computer systems.
Attends client meetings as Validation representative.
Maintains cleaning program and conducts equipment swabbing.
Performs data review/verification/analysis.
May be essential to perform alternating or rotating shift work (as required).
Supports special projects (as required).
How will you get here?
Requirements:
B.Sc. in Chemistry, Engineering, or related field.
Minimum 2 years experience in Validation within the pharmaceutical industry. Previous experience in statistical analysis an asset.
Ability to work well independently and in a team based environment.
Good computer skills (Microsoft Word and Excel).
Good writing skills with strong accuracy and attention to detail.
Excellent interpersonal skills, communication and organizational skills.
Ability to work under tight deadlines in a fast paced environment.
Proficiency with the English language.
At Thermo Fisher Scientific, each one of our 70,000 extraordinary minds has a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our singular mission—enabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer.

Thermo Fisher Scientific is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to the principle of diversity and is particularly interested in receiving applications from a broad spectrum of people. Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities are available upon request.

Title: Associate Data Scientist
Description:
“The Power of Together”
Join Northbridge, a growing dynamic company that has a long and rich Canadian history in providing innovative insurance solutions to customers nationwide.
Northbridge Financial Corporation is a leading commercial property and casualty insurance company that’s been helping protect Canadian businesses for more than 90 years. We’re 100% Canadian!
We offer a wide range of creative solutions to our customers through our Northbridge Insurance, TruShield Insurance and Federated Insurance brands where we strive to create a fair and friendly culture, upheld by the foundation of our five corporate values: respect, passion, connectedness, creativity, and excellence.
By continually striving to challenge the status quo, and by focusing on helping the customers we have the privilege of insuring achieve the possibilities of their business, we’ve been able to build our reputation as one of Canada’s largest commercial insurance providers.
To help us continue to build on this success, we’re committed to attracting, developing and retaining the best people.
Be part of a team that’s passionate about making a difference every day, fuelled by our entrepreneurial spirit and where everyone owns a part of our success. Our company has had an amazing journey so far, and our future is full of new possibilities!
Located in the heart of Toronto’s Financial District, our head office is easily accessible by TTC and GO Transit, and within walking distance to the Eaton Centre, Air Canada Centre, Rogers Centre, and CN Tower. As a national property and casualty commercial insurance provider, we also have offices across Canada.
Position Summary
Welcome to an amazing opportunity in the exciting new field of analytics and data science! Come and join the Business Analytics team at Northbridge Financial Corporation as we seek to develop and deploy analytical models using the latest in open source and cloud-based analytics solutions. Tackle a breadth of challenges from wrangling data, finding the optimal model fit, and delivering the results to our business stakeholders. Be part of an entrepreneurial team that balances independence and teamwork to achieve our goals. Experience the support of the FairVentures lab and other data science teams at our Fairfax affiliate companies as we seek to deliver the best products and services to our customers.
What you will be doing:
Develop data scripts, pipelines, and proprietary software “recipes” to convert raw data into modelling and deployment formats.
Train and test analytical models on the data, using open source and cloud based proprietary software.
Assist in communication of the model characteristics and diagnostics to business users.
Develop deployment scripts that automate delivery of model scores and results in batch and real time.
Maintain the deployed models by running and delivering reports, and debug supporting programs and tools.
Engage as assigned.in team activities and presentations that continually improve the knowledge and capabilities of the team.
Other duties
What we are looking for:
Strong programming skills
Critical thinking, analytical and problem-solving skills
Quick learner, self-motivated, team player with high energy and ability to work independently
Operate in a collaborative manner
Demonstrated commitment to ongoing professional and technical development
Project management skills
Be fun, fair and friendly
What sets you apart:
Post-secondary school education in Computer Science
0-2 years of experience in a programming role.
Qualification in a predictive analytics discipline is an asset, such as the iCAS CSPA
Academic or work experience with Python, R, git, and cloud platforms
Familiarity with API’s, GitLab or GitHub
Familiarity with any of the following tools in a cloud platform is an asset: StreamSets, HUE (Hadoop User Interface), Trifacta, RStudio Server, GitLab, RConnect, Shiny, Jupyter Notebooks, Data Robot, and Arcadia Data
Knowledge of statistical techniques and machine learning
Experience with SAS or SQL is an asset
What We Have to Offer:
Northbridge Cares program – volunteer day and donation matching
Generous paid time off, including personal days. Flexible work hours as well as early departure opportunities
Flexible Group Benefits Plan – medical, dental, insurances
Defined Contribution Pension Plan + Optional Group RRSP
Northbridge Employee Share Purchase Plan
Education Assistance Program
Employee Assistance plan
Staff Insurance - discount on home, automobile and pet insurance
Plus, the opportunity to contribute to the success of Northbridge through sharing your knowledge and experience while learning from others!
Application Process:
Northbridge welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Interested, qualified candidates are encouraged to apply below.
All offers of employment are conditional upon satisfactory background and reference checks, including a criminal record check, credit check, and employment and educational verifications.

Guiding principle: "Midpoint" of the hiring salary range means the individual possesses full job knowledge, qualifications and experience.






Job Summary


The mission of the Dennis Lab is to reduce the suffering associated with brain-related disorders. Precision or "personalized" health care is our ultimate goal, and we seek to achieve this goal by studying how differences in people's genomic code influence disease susceptibility, response to treatment, and recovery. We leverage large-scale population-level biobank data, with a major focus on administrative health databases, including electronic health records, and we work at the interface of genetics, epidemiology, statistics, bioinformatics, and computer science.

The Dennis Lab is seeking a highly qualified data scientist to lead the development of analysis pipelines for our team. The ideal candidate will have strong quantitative skills, familiarity with computer programming, and documented organizational abilities. A willingness to learn about genomic data and a desire to solve problems relevant to human health are essential.



Organizational Status


The Data Analyst will report directly to the Principal Investigator, Dr. Jessica Dennis.



Work Performed


Apply advanced statistical and bioinformatics approaches to large-scale biobank data, including (epi)genomic data and structured and unstructured data in population health registries and electronic health records;Ensure the integrity of biobank data by participating in quality control and working closely with other research personnel and collaborators on such issues;Develop and document data analysis pipelines using shareable code repositories such as GitHub or BitBucket;Maintain up-to-date knowledge of published methods, investigate suitability of novel methods, and if applicable adapt those methods to current workflows;Analyze, interpret, and document results in a digital lab notebook such as Evernote, and contribute to the generation of publication-quality tables and figures for presentations and manuscripts;Contribute to project planning and to the development of project goals, scope, and strategy;Coordinate and communicate project goals with Dennis Lab members and external stakeholders;Participate in regular lab meetings with Dennis Lab members and the Principal Investigator;Provide Dennis Lab trainees with technical guidance on study design, analysis, and statistical methods, and contribute to the development of onboarding material for new Lab trainees;Develop web portals so that shareable results may be served back to the research community and beyond;Contribute to occasional minor administrative tasks related to lab business.



Supervision Received


The candidate reports directly to the Principal Investigator, Dr. Jessica Dennis.



Supervision Given


The candidate will provide relevant training to junior staff and trainees.



Consequence of Error/Judgement


Unreliable data, leading to an incorrect generation of research results, could result in erroneous findings and faulty publications which would have serious implications for current and future funding.



Qualifications


Post-graduate degree in Statistics. Minimum of two years experience in research analysis or the equivalent combination of education and experience. Persons with a university degree in another quantitative discipline (e.g., mathematics, computer science, epidemiology) will also be considered. Expertise in statistical analysis of high-dimensional data. Experience with machine learning methods and natural language processing of unstructured data would be an asset. Facile with programming in R and Python. Experience with cluster computing and Unix shell would be an asset. Demonstrated experience working in interdisciplinary teams and contributing to the learning and advancement of junior personnel. Ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities, and to work effectively under pressure to meet deadlines. Ability to communicate effectively verbally and in writing. Ability to analyze problems, identify key information and issues, and effectively resolve.





.

Equity and diversity are essential to academic excellence. An open and diverse community fosters the inclusion of voices that have been underrepresented or discouraged. We encourage applications from members of groups that have been marginalized on any grounds enumerated under the B.C. Human Rights Code, including sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, racialization, disability, political belief, religion, marital or family status, age, and/or status as a First Nation, Metis, Inuit, or Indigenous person.


All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply; however Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority.
